embeds.title: Blocked Chakra
embeds.description:
Boss Relic / The Collector / Downfall

Gain :energy_collector: at the start of your turn. You don't draw from your Collected pile until turn 4.
*One pulled muscle is all it takes.*

messages.content: it's bad
it's basically gain one energy draw one less card
I think it,s not half bad
what Blue Guy said is technically true for the first 4 turns
it's typically not good for fights to even last over four turns

this is only good if you spefically boss swap into it. But boss swap on collector is pretty questionable. The issue this relic has is by the time you have made it to the boss chest you already have collection cards you want to use and this effectively takes them away from you in hallway fights
"boss swap on collector is pretty questionable." ???????
collector handles literally every boss swap well
I've made busted crown work
blue guy has made ectoplasm work
velvet choker definitely works
philo? you have easy strength down
pandora's? yay
snecko? free win
etc
I was deliberately using the worst possible cases
so that we would not need to do an exhaustive search
I think blocked chakra is the one swap I wouldn't be happy with, but its probably convertable into a win
the thing is
collector really wants energy
and even with the you are mine cost reduction
you still want energy because act 1 is your weakest act as collector
sentries and nob hardcore bully you
so swapping helps both in the long term by giving you something better than a miracle and by giving you immediate power
your starting relic is pretty good and collector can win every game anyways; so why swap and  give your self a small chance to lose?
what swaps even kill you on collector?
collector is not winning early sentries 100% of the time.
crown is fine bc collected pile
ecto is fine bc pyre
you are nob weak.
sozu might hurt ig
depends on your draft
your starting relic is only "pretty good" because its literally holy water but you want more than that especially early game.
but swapping can easily be pathed around 90% of the time so you don’t run straight into nob or sencheese jumpscare without prep
act 1 is flat out where you are most likely to die because of both your low maximum health and inherent weakness to sentries.
collector can handle sozu because collected cards can give a lot of defensive effects
I would say that with collector if you reach act 2 your chance of winning increases drastically so doing anything to make that happen is good.
you can realistically beat sentries every game, its just that maybe trying to beat sentries AND nob back to back might be undoable for you.
sentries as your first elite without potions can and will take 30 health from you.
you also have to weigh swap vs other neow buffs. remove/transform 2 are easy takes on collector and are far better then swap imo.
you can swap with collector, but I'm preferring other neow buffs right now.
remove / transform isn't as good as it normally is because of pyre.
you're going to be burning your basics anyways.
pyre makes them better though? Why pyre a strike when you can just not have it exist in the first place. Lets you make your deck even thinner
because instead of pyring a strike you're going to be more likely to be forced to pyre something actually important early
thats not the end of the world and cards that have direct pyre synergy are quite good
and you are actively removing cards throughout a fight anyways, the jump start of 2 cards isn't mindblowingly good.
you should be pushing for ability to win early game as much as possible with collector and that means swapping so you can handle sentries and nob far quicker
you still need cards to beat elites even if you have a 4th energy and swapping into something thats not giving you that 4th energy can make your elites slightly worse even.
4th energy enables early picks of very strong cards like finalize, it makes stash away better, it allows you to play multiple cards every turn without having to draw fuel the fire first
and swapping into astrolabe or other non energy relics tends to be better than the reserve too
i mean sure getting swaps that don’t do anything will hurt your elite odds(black star, maybe tiny house, maybe bell depending on relics)
bell is good because you can pyre the curse
yeah but it’s not good if you get 3 crap relics
even if the downside is whatever
black star swaps will be good if you just make sure you go for late act one elites
3 random relics is probably better then your starter relic
tiny house is worst case, but you're still getting a potion which means you are able to kill an early act 1 elite
then might as well just say tiny house might kill you lol
cage/astro/pandora are fine
pandora might kill you sure but it’s funny
and honestly, the first elite is literally the hardest part of the run as collector so anything that helps against it is good.
cage is like the same thing as removing 2 but you also lost your starter relic
so that means swapping is good
remove 2 almost always has a downside attached.
it always does iirc? max hp curse or gold
and I would still call it better than emerald torch
ya its downside to remove 2 but removing 1 is free
you can take remove one on collector do (acutally you can take it on most downfall characters)
remove 1 shows up everywhere
hmm what was collector ancient writing
<ancient writing>

messages.content: guess no special for collector rn

Definitely on the weaker half of energy boss relics. The drawback is pretty severe, and drawing less cards has direct anti-synergy with having mroe energy. You could compensate by trying to draft more expensive cards in general to make sure that you can spend your 4 energy on non-basics more frequently. It's especially rough since it takes away drawing collected cards, which are often going to be some of your most powerful tools, and it not only delays drawing them, but it makes it take significantly longer to draw specific ones that can be really effective in specific fights.

As a swap, I think it's manageable, but rough. You would probably want to head to an early shop to try and buy high impact expensive cards/buy potions/remove a starter ASAP to mitigate some of its drawback. I would only rarely take it as a boss reward, sometimes collector really desperately wants that 4th energy, and it is possible (but rare) to leave act 1 without a strong collected deck. If another boss relic has a more manageable drawback, or if I have enough reserve to delay picking up the 4th energy, I would normally skip this. The only real way to get around the downside of this card is with cards like dragon's trove, forgery, and soulforge, and even then you are still drawing less collected cards than normal. I feel like this could afford to be less severe than it is currently, perhaps only stopping the first 2 or 3 turns of drawing collected cards. It's a really sizeable drawback.
I would make it "all strikes and defends gain Pyre"
eh usually you pyre your strikes/defends
so i’d prefer a small kindling effect on each
Strikes and defends give 1 temp hp? Could support the calls a bit
that might also have some utility
maybe 1-2 temp hp on exhaust
